title: Documentation: Contribution guidelines not clear about CLA signing process
body:
## What I wanted to do
Submit a PR to MSBuild.

## What I did
I read the [MSBuild Contributing Code](https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/blob/3db83fdeb160404917b6bd3f4dd9e62338539a48/documentation/wiki/Contributing-Code.md) documentation.

## The problem
That document states

> You must sign a Contributor License Agreement (CLA) before submitting your pull request. To complete the CLA, submit a request via the form and electronically sign the CLA when you receive the email containing the link to the document. [...]

I interpret this as "before you submit a PR, complete the CLA signing process". But "the form" is plain text, so I don't know how to sign the CLA.

The [CLA Homepage](https://cla.opensource.microsoft.com/) states

>  When you contribute to a Microsoft open source project on GitHub with a new pull request, a bot will evaluate whether you have signed the CLA. If required, the bot will comment on the pull request, including a link to this system to accept the agreement.

I interpret this as "first submit a PR, then the bot will refer you to the form".

Please clarify this piece of documentation so that it is easier to contribute to MSBuild.
